==== In North America ====
  +
===== In The United States =====
  +
Mr ElBaradei deicied to visit the [[USA]] during [[April 2010]]. Mr ElBaradeiâs visit to the [[United States]] will include meetings with Egyptians abroad to ''"'''discuss his agenda for change and answer their questions on how to move forward'''"'', said an official from Mr ElBaradeiâs National Association for Change.
  +   +
The trip could represent an opportunity for Mr ElBaradei to focus on one of the stated goals of his National Association for Change: the enfranchisement of Egyptians abroad, many of whom have felt for years that their views on governance are neglected by the regime.
  +   +
{{Quotation|
  +
'''"I think that this is an acknowledgement that Egyptians abroad are a huge number of people"'''<ref name="ElBaradei takes his case to America">[http://www.thenational.ae/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20100426/FOREIGN/704259926/1135 ElBaradei takes his case to America]</ref>.|Issandr al Amrani|an independent political analyst based in Cairo
  +
}}
  +   +
Egyptian expatriates may have a ''natural'' affinity for Mr ElBaradei, whose global cachet resonates with expatriates who hope to see a comprehensive rethinking of Egyptâs political system.
  +   +
{{Quotation|
  +
'''"Part of the idea behind ElBaradei is that heâs a guy who has lived outside Egypt for 30 years and thereâs a feeling that, sure, he may not know Egypt that well, but he knows that in other places theyâve done things better than Egypt"'''. '''"I think that will appeal to Egyptians living abroad who have seen societies where things work better than Egypt."'''<ref name="ElBaradei takes his case to America"/>|Issandr al Amrani|an independent political analyst based in Cairo
  +
}}
  +   +
According to figures from the 2007 [[United States Census Bureau|US census bureau]], there are nearly 200,000 people of Egyptian ancestry living in the United States<ref name="Population by Selected Ancestry Group and Region: The 2007 US census bureau">[http://www.census.gov/compendia/statab/2010/tables/10s0052.pdf Population by Selected Ancestry Group and Region: The 2007 US census bureau]</ref>.
